text:
Can someone with a bit of historical knowledge of HubSpot templates help me out here :wink:
I've inherited an older site and the template module import code doesn't look like the snippets that are offered in the design manager. For example, the legacy code a module looks like this:
`% module "module_154165701869483" module_id="4269387" label="Alert Box Rich Text" %}`

but the current snippet for that module looks like this:
`{% module "module_15962296378351" path="/Ascendium/Custom_Modules/General Rich Text", label="Alert Box Rich Text" %}`
Is the first example just an older way of doing things?

Furthermore, the older version of the code still works on the old site, however, when I try to use the same template in a dfferent account (my sandbox accout), the CMS (in the content editor) has an error that it cannot find the module?
So, it seems like the old site, has some sort of redirect making the old code work, does anyone know if that's what's happening?

The reason I ask is im trying to migrate the site to sandbox and local development. It will be a nightmare if I have to replace these module imports (100s of them i suspect) in every template in order to preview these templates and modules in sandbox :confused:
